metadata.dc:author: Finn, Bárbara C
Bruetman, Julio E
Bosio, Martín
Emery, Nicholas C
Young, Pablo
Massa, María
metadata.dc:description: Granulomatosis with polyangiitis (GPA) or Wegener's disease is characterized by a granulomatous vasculitis of the upper and lower airways and kidney. It involves the lower respiratory tract causing subglottic tracheal stenosis, which occurs in approximately 22% of patients. We report two females aged 40 and 52 years, admitted to the hospital with a subglottic tracheal stenosis. Their symptoms and management are reviewed. The first patient responded to rituximab. The second patient required a tracheostomy.
metadata.dc:title: Estenosis subglótica y granulomatosis con poliangeítis (Wegener) en dos casos.
[Subglottic tracheal stenosis in Wegener disease. Report of two cases].
